recipe.title: Cauliflower "Rice" Tabbouleh
ingredients: 1/2 medium head of cauliflower (about 1 pound), coarsely chopped
2 cups (packed) flat-leaf parsley leaves with tender stems
2 scallions, white and pale-green parts only, sliced
1/2 medium cucumber (about 8 1/2" long), cut into 1/4" pieces
instructions: Grate cauliflower with the coarse grater disk on a food processor or the largest holes on a box grater until rice-like in texture. Transfer to a large, microwave-safe bowl and toss with 1 Tbsp. oil and 1/4 tsp. salt. Cover with plastic wrap and microwave on high 3 minutes. Carefully remove plastic wrap, spread cauliflower "rice" on a rimmed baking sheet, and let cool.

Wipe out food processor, if necessary, and fit with chopping blade. Pulse parsley, mint, scallions, garlic, lemon zest, lemon juice, 3/4 tsp. salt, and remaining 1/4 cup oil until herbs are coarsely chopped. Transfer to a large bowl and stir in red pepper flakes. Add cauliflower, cucumber, and tomatoes and gently toss to coat. Season with additional salt, if necessary.
Do Ahead Cauliflower "rice" can be made 3 days ahead. Chill in a resealable container.
